summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing the records, emphasizing the importance of the information contained within them, particularly regarding potential underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is identified as the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein, who is under investigation for child prostitution. He is implicated in an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names of potential victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of a child prostitution case, and his name is mentioned in relation to the investigation involving Alfredo Rodriguez and the address book.

connections.description: Alfredo Rodriguez worked as the house manager and butler for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and telephone numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The address book is believed to contain records related to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the investigation.
The investigation into Alfredo Rodriguez began in October 2009.
The document emphasizes the importance of the telephone records in relation to the ongoing investigation.
